required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pragmatic, Randomized Evaluation of Statin Active Choice to Reach Improved Outcomes Based on Evidence
clinical_study.official_title: Pragmatic, Randomized Evaluation of Statin Active Choice to Reach Improved Outcomes Based on Evidence

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investigators will conduct a pragmatic, cluster-randomized, controlled trial to evaluate an active choice intervention with and without social comparison feedback to increase physician statin prescribing rates for eligible patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is the leading cause of morbidity and mortality in the United States. Strong evidence indicates that statin medications can reduce the risk of CVD and for those with CVD statins have been shown to reduce mortality. Despite this evidence, statins are under-prescribed. In this study, the investigators will test the effectiveness of nudges targeted to physicians using active choice and social comparisons feedback to increasing the rate at which statin medications are prescribed to patients eligible based on national practice guidelines.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients eligible for a statin that have been prescribed a statin

arm_group.description: Physicians will be asked to review a list of their patients eligible for statin therapy who are not yet prescribed a statin and make an active choice whether or not to prescribe a statin.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Active choice with social comparison feedback
arm_group.description: Physicians will be asked to review a list of their patients eligible for statin therapy who are not yet prescribed a statin and make an active choice whether or not to prescribe a statin. Physicians will receive social comparison feedback informing them of how their performance compares to their peers

intervention.description: Statin options are framed to physicians as an active choice to prescribe or not prescribe a statin
intervention.arm_group_label: Active choice with social comparison feedback

intervention.description: Statin prescribing rates are communicated to physicians and along with how their performance compares to their peers
intervention.arm_group_label: Active choice with social comparison feedback

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has a primary care physician at University of Pennsylvania Health System
- Patient meets 2013 AHA/ACC guidelines for statin therapy but no record of a statin prescription in the electronic health record
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has an allergy or adverse reaction to statins documented in the electronic health record
- Patient has glomerular filtration rate less than 30 mL/min
- Physicians (and their respective patients) will be excluded if they have less than 10 patients among their entire panel that are eligible for a statin

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: No informed consent was obtained from the participants in this study.

group.title: Active Choice
group.description: Physicians will be asked to review a list of their patients eligible for statin therapy who are not yet prescribed a statin and make an active choice whether or not to prescribe a statin. Active choice: Statin options are framed to physicians as an active choice to prescribe or not prescribe a statin

group.title: Active Choice With Social Comparison Feedback
group.description: Physicians will be asked to review a list of their patients eligible for statin therapy who are not yet prescribed a statin and make an active choice whether or not to prescribe a statin. Physicians will receive social comparison feedback informing them of how their performance compares to their peers Active choice: Statin options are framed to physicians as an active choice to prescribe or not prescribe a statin. Social comparison feedback: Statin prescribing rates are communicated to physicians and along with how their performance compares to their peers

participants_list.participants: 32 primary care physicians were randomized to this arm and analyzed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Physicians and patients were from a single health care system and we did not have data on prescription fill rates.
